Who We Are:Calm is the leading mental health brand, on a mission to support everyone on every step of their mental health journey. With the #1 app for sleep, meditation and relaxation, Calm’s transformational mindfulness content supports users across seven languages in more than 190 countries.What We Do:Calm’s engineering organization mission is to build a global, trusted, mental health, technology platform. Our platform is:Accessible – anytime, anywhere, any deviceEngaging – intuitive, friendly, robustFlexible – fast, easy to use, easy to deployWhat You’ll Do:As a member of Calm’s engineering organization leadership team, you will:Create a technical strategy for ML/AI, Data Science, and Data Eng at CalmCreate a technical strategy for shared infrastructure and services that are shared across CalmWork with engineering peers, product and business stakeholders to align on the requirements and business needsManage the engineering teams, own the budget for the team, remove roadblocks, own the execution and qualityPartner with your engineering peers and the CTO to solve engineering-wide problemsManage and grow the engineering organization: You will expand, up-level, and manage engineers (people managers and individual contributors), including those embedded on other teamsGive the team clear performance objectives and goals, offer effective feedback and coach them in their ongoing developmentUse the engineering process and tools to make week-to-week execution effective, transparent and predictable. Ensure our process works for us — prioritization, estimates, deadlines, expectation-setting, road mapping, and so onIdentify the open questions in our approach to architecture and technology, and work across Calm engineering to document on an effective approachNurture an evolvable architecture that nimbly supports product and business expansionTake the lead on defining and rolling out several engineering organization processes or practices over courseUnderstand the “buy vs build” tradeoff, and make strategic judgments about where to invest the team’s resources architecturallyWork with senior leadership to get aligned with company-wide goals, and then use this context to prioritize backend initiatives appropriatelyWho You Are:15+ years of professional software engineering experienceStrong organization-building background with a focus on innovation, infrastructure development, and team motivation & buildingDemonstrated track record of recruiting, managing, motivating, and retaining a multi-site global engineering team including contractorsHigh level of executive presence demonstrated by the ability to act as the company’s technical representative to cross-functional leadershipYou have managed teams of 50+ for at least 5 yearsYou have a proven record and experience in AI/ML, Data Eng and Data Science (5+ years on the Director or VP level)You have built and operated teams that own shared infrastructure and services utilized by multiple product lines (5+ years on the Director or VP level)=You understand how to build architecture and scale it. Proven record of scaling servicesYou have a track record of executionYou are willing to get your hands dirty, it is a startup after allSkills & Qualifications:Growth mindset: receives feedback easily and incorporates it quicklyProactive executor: thoughtful in approach and decisive in decisionsPragmatic: balance scrappiness and rigorAbility to attract, manage and develop strong engineersGreat technical communicatorStrong attention to detailStrong technical architecture and leadershipStrong product and architectural instinctsNice-to-Haves: Healthcare experienceStartup experienceThe anticipated salary range for this position is $325,000 - $375,000. The base salary range represents the low and high end of Calm’s salary range for this position. Not all candidates will be eligible for the upper end of the salary range. Exact salary will ultimately depend on multiple factors, which may include the successful candidate’s skills, experience and other qualifications. This role is also eligible for equity + comprehensive benefits + 401k + flexible time off.We believe that mental health is health, and every person should be considered in the discussion. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.Calm is deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination.Calm is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, including disabled veterans. Please contact Calm’s Recruiting team if you need a reasonable accommodation or any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.
